meanings.sent1: Be careful not to touch the exposed wires, or you might electrocute yourself.
meanings.sent2: The electrician was electrocuted while working on the faulty wiring.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to electrocute the fish by dropping the toaster in the fishbowl.
meanings.sent4: The sudden surge of power seemed to electrocute the entire system, causing a blackout.
meanings.sent5: The warning sign clearly stated, 'Danger: High Voltage - Risk of Electrocution'.

meanings.sent1: In some states, criminals on death row are electrocuted as a form of punishment.
meanings.sent2: The judge sentenced the murderer to be electrocuted for his heinous crimes.
meanings.sent3: The criminal joked nervously, 'I hope they don't accidentally electrocute me before my time.'
meanings.sent4: The idea of using electricity to electrocute criminals was considered a modern form of justice.
meanings.sent5: The executioner prepared the electric chair, ready to electrocute the condemned prisoner.
